results.title: O Panama
results.creator_credit: New Television Workshop, WGBH-TV, Boston, Susan Dowling, James Benning and Burt Barr
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: O Panama, scripted by Burt Barr and filmed by James Benning, was made for TV. Immigrant (Willem Dafoe) comes to New York from an unidentified Latin American country and appears to fall ill in the middle of winter. He drifts through this illness, confined to his apartment where his imagination is free. The tedious reality of the sickness and the vivid hallucinatory visions of his delirium, are stitched together by the polarities of light and dark, hot and cold, sound and silence, day and night, presence and absence. There is no dialogue and little action as a `mental landscape…rife with heat and color’ emerges from the backdrop of a bleak urban winterscape.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Television Workshop, WGBH-TV, Boston, Susan Dowling, James Benning and Burt Barr

results.title: Nutrition for health
results.brief_description: A program from the Pork Advisory Service which discusses the need for a balanced diet and how pork can contribute to a balanced diet and our nutritional needs.

results.title: Nuclear map of Australia (Update 2)
results.brief_description: This interactive informational project researched, designed and coded by Glenn Todd, was inspired and modeled on the poster created by Scott Ludlam and released by ANAWA. It provides a definitive breakdown of the nuclear industry in Australia through text and photographs sourced from www.anawa.org.au, www.sea-us.org.au and the anti-nuclear community.

results.title: Now it can be told
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Royal Air Force. Film Production Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of the training of special agents in Britain and their subsequent work with the French resistance movement. Sabotage culminated on D Day in insurrections by thousands of armed patriots who helped to paralyse the enemy’s communications and hastened its defeat.

results.title: Nous N'irons Plus Au Bois = We Will Not Enter the Forest
results.creator_credit: Georges Dumoulin, Catherine Winter and Gisele Rebillon
results.brief_description:
During Summer 1944, a group of young people takes to the woods with orders to keep guard on four German deserters. However, Lise, a liaison agent starts a romance with Werner, one of the prisonners.

Credits: Producers, Gisele Rebillon, Catherine Winter ; director, Georges Dumoulin ; writer, Catherine Varlin ; photography, Alain Derobe ; music, Michel Sendrez.
Cast: Marie-France Pisier, Siegfried Rauch, Richard Leduc, Jacques Higelin, Jacques Masson, Siegfried Rauch, Sylvain Joubert, Georges Rouquier.

results.title: Nous les Gosses = Us Kids
results.brief_description:
A group of schoolchildren decide to work during their holidays in order to pay for a large glass window they have broken while playing soccer in the schoolyard. But their treasure is under threat. Filmed during the Occupation, this ‘poetic realist’ film extolls the virtues of solidarity and mateship inherited from the Popular Front era.

Credits: Producer, Jean Faurez ; director, Louis Daquin ; writers, Gaston Modot, Maurice Hilero, Marcel Ayme ; photography, Jean Bachelet ; music, Marius-Francois Gaillard ; art direction, Lucien Aguettand ; editor, Suzanne de Troeyes.
Cast: Louise Carletti, Gilbert Gil, Pierre Larquey, Louis Seigner, Andre Brunot, Raymond Bussieres, Emile Genevois, Paul Frankeur.

results.title: Not without sight
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zigouras, Joshua Aronson and American Foundation for the Blind
results.brief_description: Uses the example of four people with different kind of eye trouble in order to show the main courses of visual impairment and to show how these impairments affect sight.

results.title: Not just a number
results.creator_credit: Shalagh McCarthy, Rob Richardson and Amalgamated Metal Workers and Shipwrights Union
results.brief_description: A three part documentary examining industrial democracy in Australia: 1) Job redesign. Demonstrates how employees exercise decision-making, responsibility and initiative in their private lives and contracts with the usual workplace situation where most decisions are made by management. 2) Better managers. Shows a factory owned and operated by the workers providing a working example of successful worker participation and industrial democracy. 3) Is it a con? Examines unsuccessful industrial democracy initiatives where only the semblance of power has been transferred to the workers.

results.title: Not enough
results.creator_credit: Wim Van Der Velde, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development and Ben Haanstra Film Productions
results.brief_description: About responsibility to developing countries. The apathy in rich countries is contrasted with the misery and toil of people in poor countries such as India who are attempting to develop their natural resources. Population growth is seen to be greater than increases in food production.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wim Van Der Velde, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development and Ben Haanstra Film Productions

results.title: Not Crippled, Not Useless
results.brief_description: Michael Briffa is fourteen and will probably be confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life. This program explores Michael’s determination and success in being allowed to enrol in an ordinary school. As well, Michael’s parents discuss their attitudes to special schools.
